= Wiki Renderer Library - Complete Element Showcase =
This comprehensive demonstration showcases **every single element** available in the wiki renderer library. Each section demonstrates the element's usage with //detailed explanations//, ##code examples##, and educational content about cats.

{{toc/}}

== Basic Text Elements ==

=== Headers - All Six Levels ===
Headers provide hierarchical document structure. The library supports all six HTML header levels:

{{code language="typescript"}}
// All header levels - from largest to smallest
h1("Main Title")           // = Main Title =
h2("Section Title")        // == Section Title ==
h3("Subsection")          // === Subsection ===
h4("Sub-subsection")      // ==== Sub-subsection ====
h5("Minor Heading")       // ===== Minor Heading =====
h6("Smallest Heading")    // ====== Smallest Heading ======
{{/code}}

==== Example Headers in Action ====
Here are examples of the smaller header levels:

===== This is a Level 5 Header - Cat Behavior =====

====== This is a Level 6 Header - Purring Mechanics ======

=== Text Formatting Elements ===
Text can be formatted in multiple ways: **strong/bold text**, //emphasized/italic text//, __underlined text__, --strikethrough text--, ##monospace/code text##, text with ^^superscript^^ and ,,subscript,,.

{{code language="typescript"}}
// Text formatting examples - all inline elements
strong("Bold text")           // **Bold text**
emphasis("Italic text")       // //Italic text//
underline("Underlined")       // __Underlined__
strike("Crossed out")         // --Crossed out--
mono("Code text")             // ##Code text##
superscript("E=mc¬≤")          // E=mc^^¬≤^^
subscript("H‚ÇÇO")              // H,,‚ÇÇ,,O
{{/code}}

=== Paragraphs and Text Nodes ===
Simple paragraph with string content - cats are fascinating creatures.
Complex paragraph with **mixed** //formatting// and [[internal links>>CatBreeds]]. Cats have been companions to humans for over 9,000 years.
Verbatim text preserves exact formatting: {{{  <cat>  exact  spacing  </cat>  }}} - useful for code snippets or ASCII art.

{{code language="typescript"}}
// Paragraph and text examples
p("Simple string paragraph")
p([text("Complex "), strong("formatted"), text(" paragraph")])
text("Plain text node")
verbatim("Exact formatting preserved")
link("Link Text", "TargetPage")  // [[Link Text>>TargetPage]]
{{/code}}

== Lists and Definitions ==

=== Definition Lists ===
Definition lists pair terms with their descriptions, perfect for glossaries and explanations:

; Felis catus
: The scientific name for domestic cats, meaning 'cat' in Latin
; Purring
: A continuous, soft vibrating sound cats make when content, stressed, or healing
; Whiskers (Vibrissae)
: Specialized sensory hairs that help cats navigate and sense their environment
; Kneading
: The rhythmic pushing motion cats make with their paws, often called 'making biscuits'

{{code language="typescript"}}
// Definition list example
definitionList([
  definitionTerm("Term 1"),
  definitionDescription("Description of term 1"),
  definitionTerm("Term 2"), 
  definitionDescription("Description of term 2")
])
// Output:
// ; Term 1
// : Description of term 1
// ; Term 2
// : Description of term 2
{{/code}}

=== Blockquotes ===
Blockquotes highlight important information, citations, or notable facts:

> Cats have been associated with humans for at least 9,000 years, and are currently the most popular pet in the world, with over 600 million cats living in homes worldwide.

> A cat has absolute emotional honesty: human beings, for one reason or another, may hide their feelings, but a cat does not.>  ‚Äî Ernest Hemingway

> The ancient Egyptians were the first to domesticate cats around 4,000 BCE. They considered cats sacred and even > //mummified//>  them alongside pharaohs.

{{code language="typescript"}}
// Blockquote examples
blockquote([text("Single line quote")])
blockquote([
  text("Multi-line quote with "),
  emphasis("formatting"),
  text(" and multiple elements")
])
// Output: > prefixed lines
{{/code}}

== Tables and Data Display ==

=== Basic Tables ===
Tables organize data in rows and columns. Here's a basic table without styling:

|=Breed|=Origin|=Coat Length
|Persian|Iran|Long
|Siamese|Thailand|Short
|Maine Coon|United States|Long

=== Styled Tables ===
Tables support CSS styling for enhanced presentation:
(% style="border: 1px solid #ccc;border-collapse: collapse;width: 100%;" %)
|=(% style="background-color: #f0f0f0;font-weight: bold;padding: 8px;" %)Cat Feature|=(% style="background-color: #f0f0f0;font-weight: bold;padding: 8px;" %)Description
|(% style="color: #333;padding: 8px;" %)Night Vision|(% style="padding: 8px;" %)Cats can see in light levels six times lower than humans
|(% style="color: #333;padding: 8px;" %)Hearing Range|(% style="padding: 8px;" %)Can hear frequencies up to 64,000 Hz (humans: 20,000 Hz)
|(% style="color: #333;padding: 8px;" %)Flexibility|(% style="padding: 8px;" %)Can rotate their ears 180 degrees and have 32 muscles controlling each ear

{{code language="typescript"}}
// Table examples
// Basic table
table([
  row([headerCell([text("Header 1")]), headerCell([text("Header 2")])]),
  row([cell([text("Data 1")]), cell([text("Data 2")])])
])

// Styled table
table([...rows], { border: "1px solid #ccc", borderCollapse: "collapse" })
row([...cells], { backgroundColor: "#f5f5f5" })
cell([text("Content")], { padding: "8px", color: "#333" })
headerCell([text("Header")], { fontWeight: "bold", backgroundColor: "#e0e0e0" })
{{/code}}

|Maine Coon|13-18|12-15|Medium|High|Excellent|High|United States|High
|Persian|7-12|10-17|Low|Very High|Good|High|Iran|Medium
|Siamese|6-14|11-15|Very High|Low|Excellent|Low|Thailand|Very High
|British Shorthair|9-17|12-20|Low|Medium|Excellent|Medium|United Kingdom|Medium
|Ragdoll|10-20|12-17|Low|Medium|Excellent|Medium|United States|Medium
|Bengal|8-15|12-16|Very High|Low|Good|Low|United States|Very High
|Russian Blue|7-12|15-20|Medium|Low|Good|Medium|Russia|High
|Abyssinian|6-10|9-15|High|Low|Good|Low|Ethiopia|High
|Scottish Fold|6-13|11-14|Medium|Medium|Excellent|Medium|Scotland|Medium

{{code language="typescript"}}
// Sortable table example
enableSortableTables()  // Required for sortable functionality

sortableTable([
  sortableRow([...headerCells], true),  // isHeader = true
  sortableRow([...dataCells]),          // Regular data rows
  sortableRow([...dataCells])
], "uniqueTableId")  // Must have unique ID
{{/code}}

== Media and Visual Elements ==

=== Images - All Parameter Variations ===
Images support various formats and styling options using the [[image:...]] syntax:
Simple icons: [[image:icon:star]] [[image:icon:exclamation]] [[image:icon:accept]] [[image:icon:arrow_right]]
Image with style attribute: [[image:amazon-logo.png||style="width:100px; height:100px;"]]
Image with width only: [[image:amazon-logo.png||width="100"]]
Image with all parameters: [[image:cat-photo.jpg||alt="A beautiful cat" width="150" height="100" style="border: 2px solid #ccc; border-radius: 8px;"]]

{{code language="typescript"}}
// Image examples - all parameter variations
image("icon:star")                    // [[image:icon:star]]
image("logo.png", "Alt text")         // [[image:logo.png||alt="Alt text"]]
image("logo.png", undefined, "100")   // [[image:logo.png||width="100"]]
image("logo.png", undefined, undefined, undefined, "width:100px; height:100px;")
// [[image:logo.png||style="width:100px; height:100px;"]]
image("photo.jpg", "Alt", "150", "100", "border: 1px solid #ccc")
// [[image:photo.jpg||alt="Alt" width="150" height="100" style="border: 1px solid #ccc"]]
{{/code}}

=== Mathematical Formulas ===
Inline formulas can be embedded: {{formula}}E = mc^2{{/formula}}, {{formula}}a^2 + b^2 = c^2{{/formula}}, and {{formula}}\sum_{i=1}^{n} x_i{{/formula}}. Cats' jumping ability follows physics: {{formula}}h = \frac{v^2}{2g}{{/formula}} where h is height, v is initial velocity, and g is gravity.

{{code language="typescript"}}
// Formula examples
formula("E = mc^2")        // {{formula}}E = mc^2{{/formula}}
formula("‚àë(x_i)")          // {{formula}}‚àë(x_i){{/formula}}
formula("\\frac{a}{b}")   // {{formula}}\frac{a}{b}{{/formula}}
{{/code}}

== Code and Technical Content ==

=== Code Blocks - Inline and Block ===
Inline code like {{code}}const cat = new Cat(){{/code}} can be mixed with regular text. The ##code()## function automatically detects single-line vs multi-line content.
Multi-line code blocks with syntax highlighting:

{{code language="typescript"}}
// TypeScript - Cat class implementation
interface Cat {
  name: string;
  breed: string;
  age: number;
  weight: number;
  purr(): void;
  meow(): string;
}

class DomesticCat implements Cat {
  constructor(
    public name: string,
    public breed: string,
    public age: number,
    public weight: number
  ) {}
  
  purr(): void {
    console.log("*purr purr*");
  }
  
  meow(): string {
    return `${this.name} says meow!`;
  }
  
  calculateFoodPortion(): number {
    // Adult cats need ~20 calories per pound
    return this.weight * 20;
  }
}

// Usage example
const myCat = new DomesticCat("Whiskers", "Maine Coon", 3, 15);
console.log(myCat.meow()); // "Whiskers says meow!"
myCat.purr(); // *purr purr*
{{/code}}

{{code language="swift"}}
// Swift/SwiftUI - Cat management app
import SwiftUI

struct Cat: Identifiable {
    let id = UUID()
    let name: String
    let breed: String
    let age: Int
    let weight: Double
    
    func purr() {
        print("*purr purr*")
    }
    
    var dailyCalories: Double {
        return weight * 20 // 20 calories per pound
    }
}

struct CatView: View {
    let cat: Cat
    
    var body: some View {
        VStack(alignment: .leading, spacing: 8) {
            Text(cat.name)
                .font(.title)
                .fontWeight(.bold)
            
            HStack {
                Text("Breed:")
                    .fontWeight(.medium)
                Text(cat.breed)
            }
            
            HStack {
                Text("Age:")
                    .fontWeight(.medium)
                Text("\(cat.age) years")
            }
            
            HStack {
                Text("Daily calories:")
                    .fontWeight(.medium)
                Text("\(Int(cat.dailyCalories))")
            }
            
            Button("Make Purr") {
                cat.purr()
            }
            .padding()
            .background(Color.blue)
            .foregroundColor(.white)
            .cornerRadius(8)
        }
        .padding()
        .background(Color.gray.opacity(0.1))
        .cornerRadius(12)
    }
}
{{/code}}

{{code language="kotlin"}}
// Kotlin - Cat data management
data class Cat(
    val name: String,
    val breed: String,
    val age: Int,
    val weight: Double
) {
    fun purr() {
        println("*purr purr*")
    }
    
    fun meow(): String = "$name says meow!"
    
    val dailyCalories: Double
        get() = weight * 20 // 20 calories per pound
    
    val isKitten: Boolean
        get() = age < 1
    
    val isSenior: Boolean
        get() = age >= 7
}

class CatShelter {
    private val cats = mutableListOf<Cat>()
    
    fun addCat(cat: Cat) {
        cats.add(cat)
        println("Added ${cat.name} to the shelter")
    }
    
    fun feedAllCats() {
        cats.forEach { cat ->
            println("Feeding ${cat.name} - ${cat.dailyCalories.toInt()} calories")
            cat.purr()
        }
    }
    
    fun getCatsByBreed(breed: String): List<Cat> {
        return cats.filter { it.breed.equals(breed, ignoreCase = true) }
    }
    
    fun getKittens(): List<Cat> = cats.filter { it.isKitten }
    
    fun getSeniorCats(): List<Cat> = cats.filter { it.isSenior }
}

// Usage
val shelter = CatShelter()
shelter.addCat(Cat("Mittens", "Persian", 2, 8.5))
shelter.addCat(Cat("Shadow", "Maine Coon", 5, 15.2))
shelter.feedAllCats()
{{/code}}

{{code language="typescript"}}
// Code function examples
code("inline code")                    // {{code}}inline code{{/code}}
code("multi\nline\ncode")            // {{code}}\nmulti\nline\ncode\n{{/code}}
code("const x = 1", "typescript")      // {{code language="typescript"}}const x = 1{{/code}}

// Automatic detection:
code("single line") // Renders as inline
code("line 1\nline 2") // Renders as block
{{/code}}

=== HTML Content ===
Raw HTML can be embedded with or without wiki processing:

{{html}}
<div style='background: linear-gradient(135deg, #667eea 0%, #764ba2 100%); color: white; padding: 15px; border-radius: 8px; margin: 10px 0;'><h4 style='margin: 0 0 10px 0;'>üê± Cat Facts HTML Block</h4><p style='margin: 0;'>This is <strong>raw HTML</strong> content. Cats spend 70% of their lives sleeping - that's 13-16 hours a day!</p></div>
{{/html}}

{{html wiki=true}}
<div class='wiki-enhanced' style='border: 2px dashed #ff6b6b; padding: 10px; background: #ffe0e0;'>This HTML block **processes wiki markup** within the HTML. Cats have //32 muscles// controlling each ear!</div>
{{/html}}

{{code language="typescript"}}
// HTML examples
html([text("<div>Raw HTML content - no wiki processing</div>")])
htmlWithWiki([
  text("<div>"), 
  strong("Wiki markup"), 
  text(" processed in HTML</div>")
])
{{/code}}

: Clean daily, scoop waste immediately. One box per cat plus one extra.

=== Show/Hide Collapsible Sections ===
Collapsible sections help organize large amounts of content:

{{showhide}}
===== Cat Breeds by Size Categories =====

; Small Cats (5-10 lbs)
: Singapura, Cornish Rex, Devon Rex, Japanese Bobtail, Munchkin
; Medium Cats (8-12 lbs)
: Siamese, Russian Blue, Abyssinian, British Shorthair, Scottish Fold
; Large Cats (11-25 lbs)
: Maine Coon, Ragdoll, Norwegian Forest Cat, Siberian, Savannah
{{/showhide}}

{{showhide title="Advanced Feline Nutrition"}}
===== Detailed Cat Nutrition Information =====
Cats are obligate carnivores, meaning they require nutrients found only in animal tissue.

; Taurine
: Essential amino acid found only in animal tissue. Deficiency causes heart problems and blindness.
; Arachidonic Acid
: Essential fatty acid cats cannot synthesize. Found in animal fats.
; Vitamin A
: Cats cannot convert beta-carotene to vitamin A like other animals. Must get it from animal liver.
; Niacin (Vitamin B3)
: Cats cannot synthesize enough niacin from tryptophan and need dietary sources.
{{/showhide}}

{{code language="typescript"}}
// Show/hide examples
showhide([...content])                     // Default title
showhide([...content], "Custom Title")    // Custom title
// Creates collapsible sections with {{showhide}} macro
{{/code}}

== Navigation and Reference Elements ==

=== Table of Contents ===
The table of contents (shown at the top) automatically generates navigation from headers.

{{code language="typescript"}}
// Table of contents
toc()  // {{toc/}} - Automatically generates from h1-h6 elements
{{/code}}

=== Document Tree and Sub-pages ===
Document trees show hierarchical page structures, sub-pages list related content:

{{documentTree/}}

{{documentTree root="CatBreeds.WebHome" showRoot="true" limit="5" showAttachments="false"/}}

{{subPages/}}

{{subPages prefix="Cat" useTitle="true"/}}

{{code language="typescript"}}
// Document tree examples
documentTree()                                    // Basic tree from current location
documentTree("Root.Page", true, 10, false)      // Custom root, show root, depth 10, no files
subPages()                                       // Basic sub-pages listing
subPages("Prefix", true)                         // With prefix filter and titles
{{/code}}

=== Transclusion and Links ===
Content can be transcluded from other pages, and [[internal links>>CatBreeds]] connect related content. Links use the ##[[text>>target]]## syntax.
{{include reference="CatCareBasics"/}}

{{code language="typescript"}}
// Links and transclusion
link("Link Text", "TargetPage")              // [[Link Text>>TargetPage]]
transclude("PageName")                       // {{include reference="PageName"/}}
{{/code}}

== Interactive and Special Elements ==

=== FAQ Elements ===
FAQ elements provide structured question-and-answer content:
{{FAQ question="How often should I feed my cat?" answer="Adult cats should be fed 2-3 times per day with measured portions based on their weight and activity level. Kittens need more frequent feeding - 3-4 times daily."/}}
{{FAQ question="Why do cats purr?" answer="Cats purr for various reasons: contentment, self-soothing when stressed or injured, healing (vibrations may promote bone healing at 25-50 Hz), and communication with humans and other cats."/}}
{{FAQ question="How long do cats typically live?" answer="Indoor cats typically live 12-18 years, while outdoor cats have shorter lifespans of 2-5 years due to traffic, predators, disease, and other risks. Proper veterinary care extends lifespan significantly."/}}
{{FAQ question="Do cats really have nine lives?" answer="No, this is a myth. Cats are excellent at surviving falls and escaping danger due to their flexible spine, righting reflex, and keen senses, but they have only one life like all animals."/}}

{{code language="typescript"}}
// FAQ examples
faq("Question text", "Detailed answer text")
// Creates: {{FAQ question="Question text" answer="Detailed answer text"/}}
{{/code}}

=== Comments and Footnotes ===
Comments are hidden from normal view{{comment}}This is a hidden comment about cat behavior research from Cornell University{{/comment}}
, while footnotes{{footnote}}Cats have been domesticated for approximately 9,000 years, with evidence from Cyprus{{/footnote}} provide additional information{{footnote}}The ancient Egyptians were among the first to domesticate cats around 4,000 BCE for pest control{{/footnote}} that appears at the bottom of the page{{footnote}}Modern house cats descended from African wildcats (Felis lybica){{/footnote}}.

{{putFootnotes/}}

{{code language="typescript"}}
// Comments and footnotes
comment("Hidden comment")                    // {{comment}}Hidden comment{{/comment}}
footnote("Footnote text")                   // {{footnote}}Footnote text{{/footnote}}
putFootnotes()                              // {{putFootnotes/}} - Renders all footnotes
{{/code}}

This comprehensive demonstration has showcased **every single element** available in the wiki renderer library:

; Text Elements (13)
: h1-h6, p, text, strong, emphasis, underline, strike, mono, superscript, subscript, verbatim, link, hr

: faq, comment, footnote, putFootnotes, transclude
